title: Ayodhya dispute: Supreme Court to take up Ram temple-Babri Masjid case on January 4
content: The Supreme Court will take up a batch of petitions related to the Ram Janmabhoomi-Babri Masjid land dispute case on January 4, PTI reported on Monday. The matter is listed before a bench comprising Chief Justice Ranjan Gogoi and Justice SK Kaul.The top court in October had ordered that the matter be listed for January.The Supreme Court will also hear a Public Interest Litigation questioning the delay in adjudicating the case, ANI reported. The plea requests the court to hear the case on an urgent basis and in a time-bound manner.The court is likely to constitute a three-judge bench for hearing 14 separate petitions filed against the 2010 Allahabad High Court verdict that ordered a three-way division of the land on which the Babri Masjid stood before Hindutva activists demolished it on December 6, 1992.
